author: M Balaganessin
text:
The Pudukottai Municipality has sent a proposal for providing underground drainage facility at an estimate of Rs. 50 crore to five wards which were added to it about four years ago.

It was on Saturday last that the facility for the municipality was inaugurated by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa through video conferencing. The municipality had prepared the scheme for the second phase of the facility.

The wards which would be covered are 1, 2, 3, and 41 and 42 which have a population of 30,000. Previously, these wards were attached to the Pudukottai village panchayat.

According to R. Rajasekar, Municipal Chairman, the proposal had been sent to the Tamil Nadu Water Supply and Drainage Board, the implementing agency. The sewage treatment plant would handle five million litres per day (mld). The cumulative length of sewage pipelines would be 74 km and 3,400 manholes would be set up.

Jeeva Subramanian, Municipal Commissioner, said the estimate for the underground drainage facility included total renovation and strengthening of the previous panchayat roads. “These roads needed total re-laying and about Rs. 15 crore had been allocated for the strengthening and laying of new roads all across these five wards,” he said.

The facility had been designed for meeting the population requirement till the year 2040.
title: Pudukottai Municipality prepares Rs. 50-crore plan for UGD in five wards
